Description: This template deploys a osticket instance from launch config in an autoscale group behind an ALB using watchmaker.

DesiredCapacity.Description: The number of instances the autoscale group will spin up initially

AdminIAMGroup.Description: ID of the IAM group to be granted SSH access to osticket instances

InstanceType.Description: Amazon EC2 instance type for the osticket Instance

KeyPairName.Description: Public/private key pairs allow you to securely connect to your instance after it launches

LdapServer.Description: Name of LDAP server from which to import osTicket users

MaxCapacity.Description: The maximum number of instances for the autoscale group

MinCapacity.Description: The minimum number of instances for the autoscale group

osticketALBTargetGroupName.Description: Name of the ALB osticket Target Group

osticketConfigBucketName.Description: Name of the S3 bucket where the osticket config should be pulled and stored

PrivateSubnetIDs.Description: Private Subnet ID where the osticket instance(s) will run. (only select one, load balancing not tested)

SecurityGroupIdosticketInstance.Description: ID of the security group for osticket instances

osticketSNSTopicARN.Description: ARN of the SNS Topic to which to send auto scale action notifications

SvcAccountDN.Description: Distinguished Name (DN) of the osTicket Service Account to query LDAP directory

SvcAccountPassword.Description: Password of the osTicket Service Account to query LDAP directory. Must be at least 8 characters containing letters, numbers and symbols

UsersOUDN.Description: Distinguished Name (DN) of the path from which to import LDAP users

osticketSESIAMUserName.Description: IAM Username used for SES email sending (must be unique per deployment)

SESMailFromDomain.Description: SES Verified domain from which to send emails (ie example.com)

SNSSubscriptionEmail.Description: Email address to which AWS SNS events and SES IAM Account rotate confirmations are sent.

osticketScapOutputBucketName.Description: Name of the S3 bucket where the scap scan output will be copied
